title: SB 1.19.6 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 06-05-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyanan Janashala Kaya
Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Sri Vasadi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Chai Vanarottamam Deveem Saraswateem
Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 6th verse of the 19th chapter.
Chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
Yavailasach Shri Tulasi Vimishra
Krishnangri Renu Abhyadikambu Netri
Punatiloka Nubhayatra Seshan
Kastamna Sevet Marishyamanah
The meaning of this 6th verse is as follows.
The river Ganges
By which the king sat to fast
Carries the most auspicious water
Which is mixed with the dust of the lotus feet of the Lord
And tulasi leaves
Therefore that water sanctifies the three worlds
Inside and outside
And even sanctifies Lord Shiva and other demigods
Consequently everyone who is destined to die
Must take shelter
Of this river
So something about the glorification
Of this Amartana Dhyam
The transcendental river
On whose bank Parikshit was sitting to fast
In order to prepare himself
To go back to Godhead
To meet death
And thereby
And thereby
And thereby
And thereby
Go back to Godhead
So what is the special thing
About this river
That this river
Carries the most auspicious water
How is that
Because of two reasons
The water of this river
Either Ganges or Yamuna
Ganga or Yamuna
Is mixed with the dust
Of the lotus feet of the Supreme Lord
And it also contains Tulasi leaves
Now how is that
That is explained by Prabhupada in the purport
And because of this reason
The verse is telling
Therefore this water of Ganges or Yamuna
Sanctifies the three worlds inside and outside
Completely purifies all the three worlds
So whoever is the first one inside and outside of this world
and not only it purifies the three worlds it purifies all the devatas including lord shiva
shiva is the top most among the devatas
so everyone becomes purified by coming in touch with this holy water of the ganga or yamuna
therefore this verse is telling everyone who is destined to die must take shelter of this river
either ganga or yamuna is the ideal shelter for those who are destined to die
so in the purport shila prabhupada explains maharaj pariksit just after receiving the news of his
death within seven days
at once retired from family life
time is very short seven days
but he did not waste any time at all
at once retired from family life
generally in the varnashrama system
it is assumed that
people live for
100 years
so there are four spiritual stages of development of spiritual perfection
brahmacharya grahastha vanaprastha samyas
so ideally a person divides his hundred years into four parts
so first 25 years is the stage of brahmacharya one practices brahmacharya student life
then in the next 25 years
the householder life
one gets married and raises the family
then after that at the age of 51
retires compulsorily and enters vanaprastha ashrama
means leaves home pancha shoredwam vanam frajeth
goes to the forest
forest means goes
sacred place away from materialistic living away from city town village all that away from that
to a sacred place to a holy place to a place where saints live and exclusively practice
spiritual life vanaprastha that is from 50th year up to 75th year and that is preparation
for taking sanyas by renouncing all material connections 100% and that sanya stage is from
75 to the 100th year but we should also remember it is not guaranteed everybody will live 100
years especially in this kal yuga the duration of life in kal yuga shortened therefore it
is said here everyone who is destined to die and who is not destined to die everybody
is destined to die and who is not destined to die and who is not destined to die and
everybody is destined to die and who is not destined to die and who is not destined to
die and who only does is go and die but
and who you do not believe one said that all that situation will happen in the material
world in this video is broken and it will be
and then what did he do shifted himself to the sacred bank of the
river now again prabhupada will explain why even though the it was not for Gayatri opposition
translation says Ganga river, Ganges, Amartyanadhyam, Transcendental river which is referred to
as Ganga river.
Here Prabhupada is telling in the purport Yamuna, it will be explained now.
Generally it is said that the king took shelter on the bank of the Ganges, but according to
Srila Jiva Goswami, one of the previous Acharyas who is the authority on Srimad Bhagavatam.
According to Srila Jiva Goswami, the king Pariksit Maharaj took shelter on the bank
of the Yamuna.
Now Srila Prabhupada justifies why Srila Jiva Goswami says Pariksit Maharaj took shelter
on the bank of river Yamuna and not Ganga.
Srila Jiva Goswami statement appears to be more accurate because of the geographical
situation.
What is the geographical situation of Pariksit Maharaj?
That Srila Prabhupada says Maharaj Pariksit resided in his capital Hastinapura situated
near present Delhi and the river Yamuna flows down past the city of Delhi.
Even now Yamuna is flowing.
Comes from Himalayas, Yamunotri.
Comes down.
and then flows through Delhi and later on flows through Vrindavan, Brajabhumi, Yamuna
river. It divides Brajabhumi into two parts, the eastern side and the western side of the
river Brajabhumi or Brajamandal. So, Prabhupada says naturally the king would take shelter
of the river Yamuna because she was flowing past his palace door. His kingdom was situated
in present-day Delhi and along Delhi, Yamuna is flowing. As far as sanctity is concerned
the of his onsite kundalini is omitted. From the point of view of the sages in this sages'
river Yamuna is more directly connected with Lord Krishna than the Ganges than the river Ganga.
Now about Lord Krishna Srila Prabhupada mentions here one interesting fact Lord Krishna sanctified
the river Yamuna from the beginning of his transcendental pastimes in this world
how is that while his father Vasudeva was crossing the Yamuna with the baby Lord Krishna
what happened if you remember hearing or reading the birth of Krishna Krishna was born when Vasudeva
and Devaki were imprisoned by Kamsa Krishna was the eighth son of Devaki and Vasudeva so when
Krishna appeared Devaki and Vasudeva were very anxious to protect this baby child
from the hands of Kamsa
Kamsa
Kamsa killed the first six sons of Devaki
and therefore
Devaki and Vasudeva were very anxious to save
the eight child somehow from the clutches of Kamsa so Krishna being the supreme lord
seeing the anxiety of Devaki and Vasudeva to protect him he directed Vasudeva you hide me in
of Gokula in the house of Nanda maharaaj
he carried baby krushna across the river Yamuna because on one side of river Yamuna is Mathura
on the other side of river Yamuna across Yamuna the other side is Gokula

è·Ÿ Kulta was felt safe in the house of Nanda Maharaj you are not offhand, Kamsa's hands can't lay on me so Vasudeva agreed and he carried baby Krishna across the river Yamuna because on one side of river Yamuna is Mathura on the other side of river Yamuna across Yamuna the other side is Gokula, So what did this baby Krishna do to him it has been concluded someone told this was he died and then he haseping , the other-side this 100 earth person trek.
And Vasudeva do he took that baby in a basket and cross the river Yamuna to safely hide
the baby child Krishna in Gokula.
So here the description is by Srila Prabhupada when Vasudeva was crossing with baby Krishna
being carried on his head in a basket.
What happened?
The Lord fell down into the river Yamuna Krishna fell down and by the dust of his lotus feet
the river at once became sanctified this is a pastime of Krishna remember Krishna is Supreme
Lord he is not a small child.
So Vasudeva was very anxious for the protection of Krishna so he became extremely anxious
to protect Krishna when accidentally he thought the child had fallen.
But actually Krishna was performing his Leela of sanctifying the river Yamuna by falling
into the river so that his lotus feet touched the river.
So therefore it is said here it is especially mentioned herein that Maharaj Pariksit took
shelter of that particular river which is beautifully flowing carrying the dust of the
lotus feet of Lord Krishna.
Mixed with Tulasi leaves.
Now how are dust of lotus feet of Krishna and Tulasi leaves both in Yamuna?
We heard how dust of lotus feet of Krishna is in Yamuna because Krishna fell down into
the river Yamuna when Vasudeva was crossing over.
Now also Tulasi leaves are present in Yamuna because Lord Krishna's lotus feet are always
besmeared with the Tulasi leaves.
And thus as soon as the lotus feet contact the water of the Ganges in the Yamuna the rivers
become at once sanctified.
The Lord however contacted the river Yamuna more than the Ganges.
Krishna performed his pastimes in Vrindavan on the bank of the Yamuna so he was more in
contact with Yamuna than the Ganga.
According to the Varaha Purana as quoted by Srila Jiva Goswami there is no difference
between the water of Ganges and the Yamuna because both these waters are washing the
lotus feet of the same Supreme Lord.
What is the pastime of the river Ganga appearing in this world?
When the Lord appeared incarnated as Vamana he stretched his leg to measure three steps
of land.
When he stretched his leg it pierced the coverings of the universe and the water of the Karna
ocean leaked into this universe.
It washed the feet of Lord Vaman Dev and that became the river Ganga which flows through
all the planets from the topmost planet Brahmaloka to the bottom most Pataloka and purifies the
entire universe by the sacred water.
Because that water contains the dust of the lotus feet of the Supreme Lord Vaman Deva.
So therefore Varaha Purana says there is no difference between Ganga and Yamuna.
Both are washing the lotus feet of the same Supreme Lord whether Vamana or Krishna it
is only one Supreme Lord.
One and only one Supreme Personality of Godhead.
